verses.text: 愚昧人的口自取滅亡離群獨處的，只顧自己的心願；他抗拒一切大智慧。

words.note: Common in biblical contexts for 'fool' or 'foolish person'.
A key concept in wisdom literature.

verses.text: 愚昧人不喜歡明白事理，只喜歡顯露自己的心意。

words.note: Common in biblical contexts for 'fool' or 'foolish person'.

verses.text: 惡人來，也帶來藐視；羞恥的事也引致羞辱。

words.note: Frequently used in the Bible to describe those who are morally corrupt.

verses.text: 人口中的言語如同深水，智慧的泉源好像湧流的河水。

words.note: A key concept in wisdom literature.

verses.text: 在審判時，偏袒惡人、屈枉義人，是不對的。

words.note: A central theological concept in the Bible.
Frequently used in the Bible to describe those who are morally corrupt.
Often found in classical/biblical texts regarding justice.
A key term in biblical ethics and theology.

verses.text: 愚昧人的嘴引起紛爭，他的口招來責打。

words.note: Often refers to someone lacking wisdom, especially spiritual.

verses.text: 愚昧人的口自取滅亡，他的嘴唇是自己性命的網羅。

words.note: Often refers to someone lacking wisdom, especially spiritual.
Figurative: a trap or scheme.

verses.text: 搬弄是非的人的言語，如同美食，深入人的臟腑。

words.note: An idiom describing malicious gossip or stirring up trouble.
Often used metaphorically for one's innermost being or core.

verses.text: 工作懶惰的，是滅亡者的兄弟。

words.note: Here turns 'lazy at work' into 'one who is lazy at work'.

verses.text: 耶和華的名是堅固的高臺，義人投奔，就得安全。

words.note: The Hebrew name for God.
Figurative: a place of refuge or defense.

verses.text: 富翁的財物是他們的堅城；在他們的想像中，有如高牆。

words.note: Common imagery in ancient and biblical texts for security.
Combines with 想像 to mean 'in their imagination'.

verses.text: 滅亡以先，人心高傲；尊榮以先，必有謙卑。

words.note: Frequently used in biblical contexts for judgment and perishability.
Classical Chinese construction, common in older translations.
A significant theological concept in the Bible, referring to divine or human esteem.
Expresses certainty or necessity.
A core virtue emphasized throughout the Bible.

verses.text: 不先聆聽就回答的，這就是他的愚妄和羞辱。

words.note: Transforms the preceding phrase into a nominalized subject.
A frequent theme in wisdom literature like Proverbs.

verses.text: 人的心靈能忍受疾病，心靈憂鬱，誰能承受呢？

words.note: Often used in a spiritual or moral sense in biblical texts.
Similar to 忍受, but often implies taking on a burden or consequence.

verses.text: 聰明人的心獲得知識；智慧人的耳朵尋求知識。

words.note: In biblical contexts, often refers to those who possess divine wisdom.

verses.text: 人的禮物能為他開路，引他到大人物面前。

words.definition: open a way, clear a path
words.note: Verb-object compound meaning to 'open a road' or 'make way'.

verses.text: 首先陳述情由的，似乎有理，等他的鄰舍來到，才可以查明實情。

words.note: Often used in formal or legal contexts.
More formal than '原因' (yuányīn).
Turns the preceding phrase into 'the one who...'
Verb-object compound meaning 'to have reason'.
A traditional term for neighbor, commonly used in biblical texts; modern term is 鄰居 (línjū).

verses.text: 抽籤能止息紛爭，排解二強之間的糾紛。

words.note: Verb-object compound meaning 'to draw a lot'.

words.definition: cease, stop, put an end to
words.note: More literary than 停止 (tíngzhǐ).
Common in biblical contexts describing strife or conflict.
Here, referring to two strong, opposing parties.

verses.text: 觸怒兄弟，要勸他和解，比取堅城還難；這樣的紛爭，如同堡壘的門閂。

words.note: Verb-object compound meaning 'to touch anger'.
Can refer to literal brothers or fellow believers in a biblical context.
Verb-object compound meaning 'to resolve peacefully'.
Often found in historical or military contexts.
Common in biblical contexts describing strife or conflict.
More formal than 像 (xiàng).
A descriptive term for a fortified structure.
Specific term for a traditional door locking mechanism.

verses.text: 人口中所結的果子，必使自己的肚腹飽足；他嘴裡所出的，必使他飽足。

words.note: Indicates the object of a verb or agent of an action.
Used for plants bearing fruit, also metaphorically for results.
Often used metaphorically in the Bible for the results of actions or character.
Indicates strong certainty or necessity, frequently found in biblical prophecies or statements.
A more formal term than 肚子 (dùzi), often used metaphorically in the Bible for the inner being or desires.
Frequently used in the Bible for both physical and spiritual satisfaction.
Indicates the object of a verb or agent of an action.
Turns the preceding phrase into 'that which comes out'.
Indicates strong certainty or necessity, frequently found in biblical prophecies or statements.
Frequently used in the Bible for both physical and spiritual satisfaction.

verses.text: 生與死都在舌頭的權下；愛把弄這權柄的，必自食其果。

words.note: Formal equivalent of 和 (hé).

words.definition: to meddle with, to toy with

words.note: Indicates certainty or necessity.
An idiom meaning to suffer the consequences of one's own actions.

verses.text: 覓得賢妻的，就是覓得幸福，也是蒙了耶和華的恩寵。

words.definition: to receive, to be favored with
words.note: Commonly used in religious contexts for receiving divine grace.

verses.text: 窮人乞恩哀求，財主卻聲色俱厲地回答。

words.note: Often implies begging for divine grace or favor.
An idiom describing someone who is harsh in manner and tone.

verses.text: 朋友眾多的人，終必彼此破裂，但有一位朋友，比兄弟更親密。

words.note: A more formal or literary way of saying 'will eventually' or 'will certainly'.
